title.narrative: A regional dog handling Point established ( at RHIA or other nearby border location)
A regional dog handling Point established ( at RHIA or other nearby border location)

actual.value:
A full regional ISF Dog handling Unit in the town of Zahle has been donated for the purpose of covering the Bekaa region and part of the Eastern border with the main BCP of Masnaa. The donation included the kennels for 10 dogs. facilities for ISF officers with all the pre-requisite works for installation.
The second Dog Handling Unit has been planned for 2018 under the funds managed by ICMPD

title.narrative: Informed and trained local authorities (Municipalities, municipality police)

Impact indicators: I. Training the Municipality police corps to deal with refugees II. Awareness of the local authorities on Human Rights and preventive security III. Prevention of violent extremism and growth of jihadists cells among populations
Lebanon faced an increasing concern about the terrorist threat after the start of the Syrian conflict in 2011. Given the porous border and the increasing but still limited capacity of the Lebanese Armed Forces, an increasing number of terrorist fighters crossed the border into Lebanon (and an increasing number of foreign fighters passed through Lebanon into Syria), and Lebanon saw a number of large terrorist attacks. In 2014, terrorist fighters stormed the north-eastern city of Arsal, killing a number of LAF soliders and taking control over a piece of territory in Lebanon.

target.value: I. Training the Municipality police corps to deal with refugees II. Awareness of the local authorities on Human Rights and preventive security III. Prevention of violent extremism and growth of jihadists cells among populations

actual.value: A number of areas of intervention adapted to the Lebanese context were identified with the intention to implement interventions covering the Security. Social and educational sectors. Plans were developed to work with Municipal Police. schools. inmates in prisons. social support to communities in addition to organize workshops with religious leaders from different communities. Two Unions of Municipalities were identified in the mixed regions of Bekaa and Akkar and partnerships with local NGOs specialized in the different fields of intervention were planned. 20-25 municipal police officers were to be trained and equipped. and a rehabilitation programme for the inmates of Halba Detention Center was planned. and was to be supplemented by the refurbishment of the ISF police post in Halba.

title.narrative: Green Border and LCPs personnel trained and equipped

Impact indicators: I. Well-trained LCPs and border personnel II. Improved work environment at main LCPs
Since 2007, the Danish MFA in collaboration with the Danish National Police through the Danish Advisory Team (DAT) in Lebanon have supported the security agencies working on border in Lebanon with training. The baseline is therefore the previous phase of the project, which responded to the basic training needs of each of the four Lebanese security agencies. The phase 2015 – 2017 was a continuation to ongoing activities since 2007, and was carried out on the basis of lessons learned from this workII. Improved work environment at main LCPs

target.value:
I. Well-trained LCPs and border personnel
II. Improved work environment at main LCPs

actual.value:
I. More than 50 staff were trained in the various courses. and 12 people were granted the DAT approved trainers status. and are thus able to carry forward the training programme. The set of training sessions has constituted an accumulation of training experience on border management that resulted the creation of a training curriculum. The training sessions have given the graduated trainers the capacities to gain knowledge and experience in border control but added an ethical aspect to their daily duties especially when it comes to dealing with the flow of refugees.
II. To enable trainings to take place in appropriate physical facilities a number of improvements were made to the physical facilities available to the border control agencies; 1) Equipping CERSA Conference Room at RHI Airport – Beirut 2) Equipping Land Border Regiment 4 Operations Room – Baalbeck 3) Equipment for Abboudieh Border Crossing Point 4) Equipment for establishment of GSO Risk Assessment Unit

title.narrative: Regional Dog-handling units of ISF and trained personnel for use at LCPs and green border
Impact indicators: I. Two dog units consisting of dogs and handlers trained to European standard II. Dog units available for use at LCPs and border by the border forces on request

target.value: I. Two dog units consisting of dogs and handlers trained to European standard II. Dog units available for use at LCPs and border by the border forces on request

actual.value:
I. the project established. trained and equipped a new dog unit for Search and Rescue operations. based at the ISF dog handling unit at Roumieh. 9 Lebanese handlers participated. 3 of them have already had a previous dog handling training with the DNP experts. 6 14-day visits by experts from the DNP were organized to provide the necessary training to the ISF officers. To generate field-ready dog-unit capacity at the ISF. 20 dogs were selected and purchased. with the support of the DNP experts. 15 are being trained and used by the ISF dog-handling Bureau within the DK Search & Rescue training programme. 5 others are being trained and used by the ISF intelligence service.
II. A full regional ISF Dog handling Unit in the town of Zahle has been donated for the purpose of covering the Bekaa region and part of the Eastern border with the main BCP of Masnaa. The donation included the kennels for 10 dogs. facilities for ISF officers with all the pre-requisite works for installation.

title.narrative: The overall objective for the Danish support is to: “Improve Lebanese Land Border Security with a view to prevent spill over of violent extremism from Syria and handling the massive influx of refugees to the country” The overall immediate objective, which should contribute to the overall objectives, is: “Enhanced capacities of Lebanese agencies and personnel involved in land border management at all levels” Support was given to the four Project Partners: Internal Security Forces (IFS), General Security (GS), Directorate of the Customs (DC) and Lebanese Armed Forces (LAF) – administered by the decentralized unit, the Project Advisory Team (PAT).

actual.value: With the accumulated 10 years of Danish support and experience on Border Management in Lebanon. DK has built a visible image among donors and toward the beneficiaries. and despite the administrative challenges the 2015-2017 phase managed to deliver the important results. Target 1) More than 50 staff were trained in the various courses. and 12 people were granted the DAT approved trainers status and a number of improvements were made to the physical facilities. Target 2) The project established. trained and equipped a new dog unit for Search and Rescue operations. based at the ISF dog handling unit at Roumieh. 9 Lebanese handlers participated. 3 of them have already had a previous dog handling training with the DNP experts. 20 dogs were selected and purchased. with the support of the DNP experts. Target 3) A number of areas of intervention adapted to the Lebanese context were identified with the intention to implement interventions covering the Security. Social and educational sectors.
